"Bright" is a fantasy-action film set in a modern-day Los Angeles where mythical creatures such as elves, orcs, and fairies coexist with humans. The story revolves around two unlikely partners, a human LAPD officer named Daryl Ward (played by Will Smith) and an orc rookie cop named Nick Jakoby (played by Joel Edgerton).
In this gritty urban landscape, Ward and Jakoby find themselves thrown together as they uncover a powerful artifact—a magical wand—that grants immense power to its possessor. With various factions vying for control of the wand, including corrupt cops, gang members, and a secret society of dark magic users, Ward and Jakoby must navigate treacherous alliances and dangerous situations to protect the wand and prevent it from falling into the wrong hands.

"Toy Story" is an animated adventure film that takes viewers into a world where toys come to life when humans are not around. The story follows the beloved cowboy doll named Woody (voiced by Tom Hanks) who is the favorite toy of a young boy named Andy.

"Jaws" is a classic thriller film directed by Steven Spielberg that terrorized audiences upon its release in 1975. Set in the fictional beach town of Amity Island, the story revolves around a massive great white shark that begins to prey on unsuspecting beachgoers, instilling fear and panic in the community.
